ygData.subject: RE: [EverQuest] About loot order
ygData.msgSnippet: That plan could work...  And as you say... you would need a lot of trust..... I find tho... that every time you get a real good group going, someone always
ygData.messageBody:
>
That plan could work...  And as you say... you would need a "lot" of trust..... 
 
I find tho... that every time you get a real good group going, someone always has to leave!  grrrrrr  
 
Once in a group one guy was picking up everything....   I asked to loot some too.. He said he would divide later....  Guess what?    Later never came.    Out of the blue he says "  Oh...  I have to go... "   And poof he was gone...  
 
So trust is a #1 priority in that case.....
 
 
Cercie
 
Heh...that would be one guy I'd never group with again.

and I don't understand the term "ffa"

alpha looting is okay in my opinion...

What I'd like to have happen is that one person with a lot of bags loot
everything and then at the end of the battle he /split p g s c for the rest
of the group
but then that would include a bunch of trust...

and then he calls off everything he'd looted while we were grouped...


then again...you really have to trust someone a bunch....



> -----Original Message-----
>
From:      Su [SMTP:suceress@...]
>
Sent:      Tuesday, May 01, 2001 10:16 AM
>
To:      EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
>
Subject:      [EverQuest] About loot order
>
> Recently in some of the groups I've been in, we've
had a few problems with
> loot order. Often, the tanks will insist
on FFA. But since I play the main
> healer and am expected to sit
and med (only getting up to heal) I get
> totally screwed. I never
get loot. But then when we try to establish alpha
> loot some people
complain. They don't care about the casters. All they
> care
>
about is getting loot for themselves. These people partake in
>
"ninja-looting". They loot everything really fast so nobody else gets a
> chance. And even when we establish a regular loot order some
people will
> still loot out of turn.
> And then we have times
when people say we roll for certain types of loot.
> When I first
joined a group, this one guy told me it was ffa (and he was a
>
ninja-looter) but that "bronze" and ore were rolled for. I saw that he
> picked up an FS morning star and wanted to roll for it (bc it's
an
> expensive
> item). He said no, it was only for bronze,
not FS. So later he picked up a
> bronze weapon. I said, "ok, let's
roll for it". He said, "no, that's only
> for bronze
armor"...
> Has anyone else had this problem?
> What do you
think is the best and fairest loot order?
> Just wondering.
>
luv,
> -Su
> ps. alpha loot with 3 loots per turn (per person)
works pretty well when
> people cooperate.
>
>
